alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Somerset; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 2:49PM EDT until June 26 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hunterdon County in northwestern New Jersey... Southwestern Morris County in northern New Jersey... Central Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... Northwestern Somerset County in northern New Jersey... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 249 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sand Brook, or 16 miles west of Somerville, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Hackettstown, Byram, Washington, Mendham, Flemington, High Bridge, Clinton, Peapack And Gladstone, New Hope, Oxford, Hope, Glen Gardner, Chester, Hampton, Frenchtown, Lebanon, Califon, Far Hills, Stockton and Brass Castle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 31. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 14. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 21 and 24. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
